meanings.sent1: Adding too much salt vitiates the taste of the soup.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the milk out for too long vitiates its freshness.
meanings.sent3: Overcooking the pasta vitiates its deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: His constant complaints vitiates the positive atmosphere in the office.
meanings.sent5: The rain vitiates the outdoor wedding, making everything soggy and damp.

meanings.sent1: Using expired medicine vitiates its ability to cure illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring the warning signs can vitiates the effectiveness of the safety measures.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leak with tape only vitiates the repair effort.
meanings.sent4: The lack of communication vitiates the team's chances of success.
meanings.sent5: The fog vitiates the visibility on the road, making driving unsafe.

meanings.sent1: A missing signature can vitiates the contract.
meanings.sent2: An error in the document vitiates its legal validity.
meanings.sent3: The incorrect calculation vitiates the final result.
meanings.sent4: The false testimony vitiates the entire case.
meanings.sent5: The virus vitiates the effectiveness of the vaccine, rendering it useless.
